attributes.action: Increase the frequency of  river buses and make them available on the weekends
attributes.background: TfL river buses are a great way to travel in London. They are the least frequent means of transportation when compared to tubes and buses and they don't run during the weekends. We believe that making them more available will improve the quality of travel and life for most Londoners.

rejection.details:
London River Bus services are the responsibility of Transport for London (TfL). TfL is accountable to the London Assembly, not the UK Government and Parliament. 

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here:

https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions
